title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic Greek poem following Odysseus' long journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romantic comedy of manners exploring love, reputation, and class.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about surveillance, totalitarianism, and truth.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A profound story of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A vision of a technologically advanced but dehumanized future society.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic story of wealth, love, and the American dream in the 1920s.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An expansive novel interweaving personal and historical narratives during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield's candid narrative of teenage angst and alienation.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological exploration of guilt, morality, and redemption.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins' adventurous journey with dwarves to reclaim their homeland.
